title: Mignon Lee-Cheun Loh, MD
author: Dante Quincy; CA
description: Mignon Lee-Cheun Loh, MD, Chief, Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology, Bone Marrow Transplant and Cellular Therapy, Director, Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research, Professor, Pediatrics
cleaned_text: Mignon Lee-Cheun Loh, MD [Cancer and Blood Disorders Center](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/clinics/cancer/), [Leukemia Program](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/clinics/cancer/services/leukemia-lymphoma/) On staff since Title: Chief, Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology, Bone Marrow Transplant and Cellular Therapy Academic Title: Professor, Pediatrics Research Title: Director, Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research Foundation Title: Aldarra Foundation, Bill and June Boeing Founders, Endowed Chair in Pediatric Cancer Research Research Center: [Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/research/centers-programs/childhood-cancer/) - Dr. Mignon Loh is center director for the Ben Towne Center for Childhood Cancer Research and chief of the Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology, Bone Marrow Transplant and Cellular Therapy, overseeing the Cancer and Blood Disorders Center at Seattle Children's Hospital. Her research focuses on how and why leukemia progresses, as well as making genomics discoveries in the lab that translate into new and better diagnostics and therapeutics for children, adolescents and young adults with leukemia. - - Dr. Mignon Loh is simply THE BEST. Her brilliant and compassionate care of my daughter saved her life and has given her a bright and promising future, despite being a leukemia survivor. Dr. Loh is an expert who listens and cares deeply about her patients. I trust her completely. She is a rock-star doctor and our family's heroine. - Dr. Loh treated our daughter at UCSF. She was very responsive and caring to our daughter and our entire family. Simply, she and her staff were wonderful! - - Other Publications - Wintering A, Ishiyama K, Tamaki S, Tamaki C, Fandel J, Ji L, Wood BL, Shah NN, Yuan CM, O'Brien MM, Loh ML, Diaz-Flores
